title: 9 big questions about the ‘Super Mario Bros. Movie’ trailer
description: Here's a question: How many Toads is Keegan-Michael Key playing?

title: ‘Overwatch’ died for ‘Overwatch 2.’ It was totally worth it.
description: “Overwatch 2” rewards sound fundamentals such as aim and game sense over grossly overtuned abilities. That's a good thing.

title: Video games harm the environment. A climate researcher wants to fix that.
description: What will it take to make video games go green? "Is it by making hardware last longer? Is it by changing something about the way the game works?"

title: Meta warns 1 million Facebook users their login info may have been compromised
description: Facebook parent Meta is warning 1 million users that their login information may have been compromised through malicious apps.

title: They thought of everything for ‘Street Fighter 6’
description: “Street Fighter 6” is a fusion of the parry system from the third game, the chunkiness of the fourth and the mechanics of the fifth. That's high praise.

title: U.S. imposes tough rules to limit China’s access to high-tech chips
description: The U.S. is taking the toughest steps yet to restrict China's access to U.S. computing technology, saying Beijing is using it to modernize its military.

title: Biden issues order boosting privacy checks for data flows from Europe
description: The order puts into practice a preliminary deal struck between President Biden and European Union leaders in March that added checks on the collection of Europeans’ personal information by U.S. intelligence agencies.

title: Google won’t let you talk to the latest language AI. This startup will
description: Two top artificial intelligence talents left Google to create a new chatbot start-up that lets users experiment with the latest in language AI.

title: Your boss can monitor your activities without special software
description: Apps like Microsoft Office, Zoom, Google Workspace and Slack may provide bosses information on workers’ digital activities. But experts say it’s not an accurate representation of productivity or performance.
